channel.title: Intellectual adventure of ancient man
channel.description:
This series, based onThorkild Jacobsen's book, "The Intellectual Adventure of Ancient Man," seeks to describe the "good life in ancient Mesopotamia."

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Mesopotamian civilization, part two
item.description: This second program in the series talks about the legendary character of Gilgamesh and how he reflected values held in Mesopotamian society.
item.dc:creator: Jacobsen, Thorkild, 1904-1993
item.dc:subject: Philosophy & Ethics

item.title: Mesopotamian civilization, part one
item.description: The first program in this series describes how obedience to authority was at the center of Mesopotamian culture.
item.dc:creator: Jacobsen, Thorkild, 1904-1993
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Mesopotamian civilization, part three
item.description: The third and final program in this series describes how Mesopotamian gods were an integral part of the culture.
item.dc:creator: Jacobsen, Thorkild, 1904-1993
item.dc:subject: Philosophy & Ethics
